intro: Cyperus helferi, commonly known as the slender flatsedge, is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes grass-like plants. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in wet or seasonally flooded habitats. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered spikelets that are often subtended by bracts. Cyperus helferi is native to parts of Africa and is often found in marshy areas or along water edges. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
